channel.title: Self-Development on Tales of a technology enthusiast
channel.description: Recent content in Self-Development on Tales of a technology enthusiast

item.title: 2022 Goals
item.description: The beginning of the year is always a good time to reflect and think about what we want to achieve. The past two years have been tough for everyone.

item.title: A Day in the life of a Developer Advocate at AWS
Kanban - get more things done!
item.description: Photo by Daria Nepriakhina on Unsplash A bit more than 3 years ago when I took the responsibility for a large region with 21 people spread all over the territory, I felt overwhelmed very quickly.

item.title: Career advice and the need for mentoring
item.description: Photo by rawpixel on Unsplash At the ServerlessConf this week, during the lunch break, one young guy approached me and asked for some career advice: “how did you know you wanted to do what you do?

item.title: Network automation - how to start?
item.description: coding…. I don’t talk much of my work in this blog and won’t go in the details here. In my role Technical Evangelist, one of my mission is the field enablement: transfer of knowledge from engineering, best practices as well as training on “adjacent technologies” i.

item.title: ServerlessConf'18 in San Francisco - Day One
item.description: ServerlessConf Serverless The creation of an Alexa skill in 2016 was this aha moment I discovered the concept of serverless or more precisely Function as a Service a.

item.title: 30 days challenge!
item.description: Today, I took the resolution to go on a 30-day challenge. And it is not about diet :-) When was my last post? December 31st!!!!! I have plenty of ideas I want to share, plenty of experience other people could (might?

item.title: Goodbye 2017!
item.description: December 31st. There are few hours left before the New Year, kids are having a nap, house is quiet. Probably the right time to reflect upon 2017, another crazy year with so many things that happened.

item.title: Continous Learning
item.description: Lean concept I see myself as a Lean Practitioner and I try, as much as I can, to stick to Lean’s principles. Lean was coined from a book written by James P.
